file_content.text: If you say so.
Don't mind me.
If I had something to say, I wouldn't hold back. You know me.
Quitting now? Smartest thing we'll do all year.
Nothing to talk about. Just trying to simplify our lives.
So. Ground rules? Master Kiwiiks let me do whatever, long as I wasn't in her way.
Do what I do and you'll be fine.
Just follow my lead, Kira.
We make it up as we go. Nifty.
Are you planning to carry on like this for the whole trip?
You talk too much.
Might also sing. That a problem?
When I need you, do exactly as I say. The rest of the time, be invisible.
I'm not her.
Too bad I lost the stealth field generator.
Question two... what's my job on the ship? Hate standing around. Makes me antsy.
Listen to the starship broadcast frequencies. If the enemy makes a move, I want to know about it.
Monitor comm traffic.
Thrilling work. But I'll take it.
It's a big ship. There's plenty of work. Do what comes naturally.
Pick something.
Reprogram the computer to call me "Master"? Done.
Don't touch anything. Don't try to help. Stay out of my way.
Get used to doing nothing.
Got it. My job: avoiding you.
We'd better get moving. Let's go save the galaxy.
Still remember the first time I met you on Tython.
All I could think was, "Why's Master Satele fawning over this guy?"
Not like I didn't understand the attraction. It's just... she's old. Never really stood a chance.
No one else even comes close to you.
Nobody does.
Pushed your luck on Voss--but that creepy red girl got nothing on me.
I'll be keeping it that way.
Master Satele couldn't steal me from you?
Is that so?
She'd have to want to, first. Doesn't seem to be your biggest fan, lately.
Please, "Master." I've got more to give you than a fancy rank.
She could try. It'd be funny.
You were so cocky and full of yourself back then.
You didn't impress me.
Letting that slide, on account of the irony.
Point is, I know a good thing when I see it--and you're not getting away.
Someday, let's retire from this Jedi business. Spend the rest of our lives having fun.
That's a future worth fighting for.
I like this plan.
I enjoy fun, but what about our legacy?
Maybe have children?
We're already breaking the Council's rules against relationships. Might as well have children, too.
Scary, not sure it's possible... but why not? Just don't complain when they start breaking their toys with the Force.
All right, but you're in charge of cleaning up after them. Force-sensitive children make big messes.
Here's to the future, tough guy.
Dream on, Kira. The Council doesn't allow vacations.
Nobody retires from the Jedi.
We'll invent some mission very far away. Fake our deaths. Whatever. Trust me, it'll be great.
We could start a family. While we're breaking Jedi rules, may as well go for broke.
All I could think was, "Why's Master Satele fawning over this girl?"
Now I know. You're the best Jedi in the order--and a good friend.
Funny--that's exactly how I feel about you.
You're too kind, Kira.
I'll take the friend part, but we both know who wears the Jedi pants around here.
With you and me together, the Sith don't stand a chance.
We're an unstoppable team.
I'll always have your back, boss.
That's why I like you, Kira. You acknowledge my incredible greatness so I don't have to.
I am pretty amazing.
Single-handedly defeating the Empire keeps you busy. Try to help where I can.
Not to get sentimental, but... if anything happens to you, I'll take care of your people. Don't worry about them.
Thank you, Kira. That means a lot.
I won't.
Figure you carry enough on your shoulders. Never hurts to have backup.
Everyone on this ship is pretty good at taking care of themselves.
This crew is tough.
Please. Have you met Doc?
Don't be silly. You're much more likely to die first.
Nothing will happen to me.
Nice.
Let's go, partner. Still got plenty of work to do.
Been thinking about that bad party we went to on Voss. Raises a lot of questions.
If Tannac was being honest, the Children of the Emperor are still hearing his voice. That bother you?
The Sith shouldn't be receiving messages from a dead man.
Yes.
Tannac could've been lying. There's no point worrying until we know more.
There's a lot we don't know.
Too bad he got our only lead killed. Poor Suri.
Suri's not answering the holo. Big surprise.
Why should it? I'm still not convinced your friend wasn't just insane.
Not really.
Possibly... but something had to set her off.
Plenty of Force users keep jabbering long after they're dead. Emperor might be one of them.
He may be reaching out to his servants. Manipulating them toward some new goal.
It's something to consider.
Ugh. Can't he just die already?
We still haven't learned how the Emperor was able to control people. This could simply be a by-product of that.
Anything's possible.
Just wish we knew for sure. Keep waiting for the other boot to drop.
You knew him better than I did. What's your gut tell you?
What do you believe?
Hey, you say he's dead. Doesn't matter what I think.
One bright spot to this: I'm not hearing strange voices. The Emperor and me? Definitely over.
Suri needs help. Let's not keep her waiting.
Just got an interesting holomessage. Childhood friend of mine. Think you'll want to see it....
He's gone. Everyone knows that. But his voice... still in my head.
Can't sleep. Nothing makes sense. The Emperor is dead. Why is he still talking?
You silenced him, Kira. Show me how. Please....
Name's Suri. Trained with her on Korriban before I left. She's a Child of the Emperor.
A Child of the Emperor, seeking help from a Jedi?
Why is she calling you?
Not just any Jedi--the only ones to break the Emperor's control.
Is there a chance the Emperor survived? Is he trying to contact his slaves?
Could he be alive?
Don't look at me. I'm just the messenger.
The Sith know we killed the Emperor and want revenge. They're trying to draw us out.
Has to be a trap.
Come on--even the Sith aren't this obvious.
Suri's gone rogue from the Empire. Holed up at one of our favorite vacation spots: Voss.
And whether or not we can help her, we sure don't need another crazy Sith wandering Voss.
We'll set course for Voss immediately.
Agreed.
Even if this distress call is real, she doesn't sound too reasonable. She may attack us.
Be ready for a fight.
Fair enough, but let's give her a chance.
I already stopped the Emperor's plan for that world. What happens to the Voss now is their problem.
I don't care about Voss.
Maybe, but the Sith will always be our problem--and they're still on Voss.
I have Suri's coordinates. We'll confront her together and figure this out.
All right, tough guy. We need to have "the talk." Know the one I mean?
I think so, but maybe you could help me out....
Possibly.
Whenever you call me "tough guy," I know kissing is somehow involved.
Is it a relationship thing?
Don't pucker up just yet.
Our deep and meaningful chat will have to wait.
We're not doing this.
Uh-uh. Not getting away that easy.
Emperor's dead, galaxy's temporarily saved. Time to focus on us.
Just because the galaxy might implode any second, doesn't mean we drop everything else.
Fact: We love each other. Fact: We have to keep that secret. Question: How can we have a life together?
That's what we have.
Answer: let's get married.
We can't.
While back, you forced a confession out of me. Never told me how you felt, though. What's that say about our relationship?
We are what we are.
I love you. Marry me.
Don't make this complicated.
We're good together. Question is, what kind of life are we going to have?
We're making the most of things. What more can we have, Kira?
Let's take what we can get.
To not spend another night like that one on Voss.
Something happened on Voss. Don't bother asking how I know. Just do.
I'm not fighting this war for anyone but the woman I love. The one who makes this ship into a home.
We can get married.
I'll spend the rest of my life with you, Kira--if you'll let me.
Course I will. Thanks for asking.
If anyone finds out about us, we'll never see each other again. Wouldn't you rather keep what little we have?
Maybe we shouldn't.
Key word there is "little." We need more.
Especially after Voss. Not a fan of you going off on sleepovers.
You spent an extra night on Voss when you didn't have to. I can guess why.
Thing about secret relationships is, it's easy to forget you're in one. Don't want to be forgotten.
I can't imagine my life without you in it, but we can't ignore who we are.
Duty comes first.
As Jedi, we must place our service to the Republic above personal desires--or fears.
This was stupid. Forget I said anything.
We still have an Empire to defeat. Better get back to it.
Let me make sure you never feel forgotten.
Then marry me.
I love you, Kira. I commit my life to you and only you. Forever.
Forever sounds about right....
Shame we can't throw a party and invite everyone--but this'll do.
At least we don't have to sit through an awkward toast from a friend who's had too much to drink.
I agree.
Teeseven can really ramble when he's had a few oils.
I could arrange a ceremony on some out-of-the-way planet.
Are you sure?
Don't bother. Couldn't top what we just did.
I'll send the others on a mission. We'll have the ship to ourselves.
[Flirt] It's not over.
Make sure it's an especially long mission.
A girl could get used to this. Probably best if I don't, at least until this war's over.
Sooner we get rid of the Empire, sooner we can enjoy moments like this full-time. Let's get cracking, handsome.
You're allowing fear and desire to control you. Jedi shouldn't be afraid of anything.
[Flirt] Stop worrying. Enjoy.
I can't promise a life together, Kira--only what there is right now. In the end, that's all any of us have.
Never know what the future holds, huh? Could both be dead tomorrow.
Maybe we should focus on enjoying today--just in case....
Knowing every time we're together might be the last? Kind of a thrill.
Living in the moment sure beats worrying about the future.
It really is.
Fair point.
This means we won't be having "the talk" again, right?
We're good, then?
Not necessary.
Personally, I try not to think about dying when I'm with you.
You're so strange.
Maybe you should start. It's fun.
What are you waiting for, a post-mission debriefing? Back to work, tough guy.
Always hoped killing the Emperor would end this war. Wishful thinking, huh?
The Empire seems more dangerous than ever.
Yes, unfortunately.
Wouldn't call myself a history buff, but I've been thinking about the past a lot lately.
Conflicts this large only end when both sides are ready for peace.
That isn't how wars are won.
Hard to imagine the Empire signing a treaty they didn't force down our throats.
I'll personally execute every Sith who replaces the Emperor. Sooner or later they'll take the hint.
We'll have to keep killing.
Now that's wishful thinking.
Keep wondering what it'll take to put the Sith Empire down for good. Kill the Emperor? Destroy Korriban?
Our goal is to force the enemy to surrender, and we'll fight until that happens.
Whatever it takes for peace.
When have the Sith ever surrendered?
Genocide is a poor method of securing peace.
There must be a better way.
Beginning to agree with you there.
No reason to stop there. The Sith have plenty of other strongholds.
For starters.
Exactly. We could stay busy the rest of our lives.
No "victory" over the Sith ever lasts. We wipe them out, they turn up again. Doesn't feel like we're winning.
It isn't about winning and losing, Kira. It's about the people we protect.
We can't afford to quit.
Good slogan. Really think it's enough?
The cycle of war has to end. Maybe you'll discover how to break it.
A wise insight, Kira.
Solve a millennia-old problem by myself? No pressure there.
That attitude is the reason we don't win. People like you refuse to see this through the end.
Stop this cowardly talk.
The end of what? You have a plan besides "blow up everything"?
Guess there is one thing we can count on: No matter how many times they come back, the Sith always go down in flames.
Finally got the skinny on how we become an official Jedi twosome. Short version? Not happening.
We'd only ever see each other on Tython. Senior Council members would review us monthly. Make sure we stay "detached."
Not the worst part. Council only grants approval to Jedi raised by the order from birth. We're disqualified.
The kicker? Deal's only offered to Jedi raised by the order from birth. Don't know about you, but I'm disqualified.
The clincher is, only Jedi who were raised by the order from birth get permission. I'm automatically disqualified.
At least we have our answer.
There's nothing to be done.
Still plenty of questions left. What happens when Master Satele catches us, for starters.
All we can do is keep our relationship a secret.
We have limited options.
How much longer can we pull the hood over Master Satele's eyes? The lady's not stupid.
We can do what we want. We don't need permission.
Forget the Council's rules.
Maybe not, but we might need a good alibi someday. Master Satele? Smart lady.
We push this any further, might end up like Jomar and Leeha.
The longer we keep things going, the harder they'll be to stop.
Not going to ruin your life, tough guy. You want out of this? Just say so.
I'd rather face down the whole Council than lose what we have.
[Flirt] Never.
For a man of action? Got a way with words.
Don't make me decide everything. This affects both of us.
What do you want?
Gonna make me say it, aren't you? Fine.
I love you, dummy. Always will. I don't want this to end. There. Happy?
I want this, too. Very much.
Yes.
Could've just said so. Saved me the speech....
Just needed to hear you say the words. And I love you too--"dummy."
[Flirt] Thrilled.
That's only funny when I say it....
So much for upholding the Jedi Code. Guess we're outlaws.
We're only outlaws if we get caught. So let's not.
Not necessarily.
A simple plan. I like it.
We'll find a way to live with the guilt... somehow.
[Flirt] Pretty much.
Won't be easy, but we have to try. And try, and try....
Nope, still feel guilty. You'll have to try harder next time....
I've always wanted to be an outlaw.
I like the sound of that.
Consider your wish granted, tough guy.
Better get back to saving the galaxy. Don't want people thinking we've gone soft.
I can't shake this feeling what we're doing is wrong. I don't want either of us getting hurt.
We shouldn't be together.
That's as good a way as any to end things. Fun while it lasted.
Back to saving the galaxy, then....
From now on, we're just friends.
It's over, Kira.
Don't kid yourself. All we can do is pretend.
And now I'll just go pretend to do important work. I... I'll see you.
So when do I get my own Padawan? Always wanted to be a teacher.
When Master Satele thinks you're ready for the responsibility, she'll tell you.
The Council decides that.
Bet a good word from you would speed that along.
It's true. I'm learning all kinds of things from you.
[Flirt] You already are.
Helps that you're an excellent student--but that's not what I mean.
Patience. You'll have your wish, someday--and that student will be in excellent hands.
You'll be great.
Be a shame not to share my wisdom. Been racking it up fast, lately.
Just because you're a Knight doesn't mean you know how to train another Jedi.
Try being a student, first.
True enough. Keep thinking Jedi are supposed to be nice.
Here, pretend you're my Padawan. Got a hypothetical moral dilemma for you.
Say you could only save the Republic or the Jedi Order. Which would you choose and why? Don't think--answer.
That's too big a question not to put a little thought into.
Thinking is important.
Bzz! Too late. The Jedi Order and the Republic are both dead. Happy?
Correct answer was "Jedi Order," by the way. Without us around to protect it, the Republic can't survive.
Jedi are guardians of peace and justice, but the Republic embodies those qualities. It comes first.
I'd save the Republic.
Wrong answer, Padawan. If the Jedi Order is destroyed, who will save the Republic? The Jedi have to come first.
Without a Republic to defend, would we still be Jedi? Or would we become something else?
That premise is flawed.
Interesting point, Padawan. I'll answer your question... later.
Jedi can exist without the Republic, but not the other way around? Interesting notion.
Intriguing theory.
Puts this war in perspective, doesn't it? We're not fighting for them. They're fighting for us.
This teaching thing's fun. Have to do it again sometime.
You don't know what you're talking about. And stop calling me "Padawan."
You're an idiot.
Don't get your robes in a twist. It was only a game.
Still say I'd make a great teacher. Just need to find a better student....
We're all that prevents the Sith from conquering the galaxy. Without us, there'd be no Republic.
Jedi, of course.
Excellent answer, my Padawan. Have a sweet flatcake.
See? I'd make a nifty Master. Learned from the best, after all.
Want to hear something crazy? I've done more fighting as a Jedi than during my entire Sith training.
I wish it didn't have to be this way.
How sad.
On the bright side? Still alive.
I doubt even the Sith would force children to duel.
You were only a child.
Are you kidding? Killed my first tuk'ata--big scary thing--when I was six.
Jedi always win because Sith don't practice enough. Case closed.
That's why Sith fail.
More like Jedi don't have to worry about getting stabbed in the back by their peers. Well, usually....
Not easy playing backup to the greatest Jedi warrior in the galaxy.
Won't even pretend we'll ever be equals, but I've got some new moves to try out next time we're in a fight.
Don't be so enthusiastic. Those "new moves" are designed to hurt people.
Temper your eagerness.
Nobody who doesn't have it coming.
Don't save all your new moves for the enemy.
[Flirt] You tease.
Still got plenty of tricks you've never seen. Have to save something for a rainy day.
Don't surprise me with anything. What kind of stunts are you planning?
Give me a preview.
Just taking a few pages from your flashy playbook. Promise not to upstage you.
Don't forget who's in charge. I call the shots on the battlefield.
Remember your role.
Of course, General. I just deliver the payload.
Been doing some light reading lately. Amazing, what's tucked away in the Jedi Archives.
Still hunting down exact details, but get this: The Council can grant Jedi the right to "attach" under certain circumstances.
Heavily monitored, of course. Probably need a special license, but still... interesting.
We could openly declare our relationship.
I see your point.
You just admitted we have a relationship. Gotcha.
The Council expressly forbids Jedi from romantic involvement. There has to be a catch.
Sounds too good to be true.
Being the Jedi who saved Tython from certain destruction might earn us special consideration.
Don't you get a little thrill from going behind the Council's back?
[Flirt] That's the fun part.
Who doesn't? But I worry about tarnishing my perfect reputation.
We wouldn't be the first, you know. I've even found records of Jedi who were married. Had children.
Not that I'm suggesting we... you know. I like things the way they are.
If there's any chance we could have the same happiness as normal people, don't you want to try?
[Flirt] But we could be more.
Lot of hurdles to cross. We're not exactly a perfect genetic match.
Never said I was opposed to making changes....
You're the one who brought this up. Isn't there a reason?
Are you sure?
Trying to make life less complicated, that's all.
Let's not ruin a good thing by making it official.
[Flirt] Me, too.
Just gathering information, tough guy. Nothing wrong with that.
Mmm... eyes are tired. Too much reading. Need to relax.
Meet me in my quarters in two minutes.
[Flirt] I'll take care of you.
Actually, sneaking around can be kind of fun....
I'm suddenly motivated to find out more about the Council's special permission. Let you know when I do, tough guy....
You can't stop researching now. We need to know how the Council's permission works.
Keep reading the archives.
Fine--but you're coming to keep me awake....
That was three hours completely wasted. Must be in some obscure entry. I'll search again later.
Don't know about you, but all I can think about right now is sleep. Sweet dreams....
Think I'll go see what the others are up to. Have a nice nap.
I'm not in the mood.
You rarely miss, but when you do, it's by a light-year. Have fun playing with the boys.
If I find anything more about how the Council's permission works, I'll let you know. Maybe....
Funny trivia... that gang on Nar Shaddaa I wiped out? The Ur'kossags? Tried to recruit me away from the refugees.
Said I'd be better off with them. They had credits, food, cute little clubhouse. All I'd have to do is kill a rival gangster.
If you'd joined that gang, we probably wouldn't be here.
I'm glad you refused.
Still the hardest choice I ever made. I'd been living in a cargo crate for years, eating leftover food from the Promenade.
Your obligations wouldn't have ended there. They'd have asked much worse things from you.
They would've twisted you.
Know it now, knew it then. Still considered joining them.
Security in exchange for killing a criminal? Might have been worth it.
Why didn't you take the offer?
Spent a sleepless night back then wondering that same thing.
Had the Force and Sith training to use it. Could've been running that gang, if I'd wanted. Instead, I did the right thing. Mostly.
Violence is wrong--I get that. But my friends are safe because the other gangs are scared of ending up like the Ur'kossags. Ironic.
The Force is generated by living things. Jedi should never grow comfortable with death.
Killing is always wrong.
Master Satele once told me we should reflect on the lives we take. Have you ever done that?
Don't think about it much. Gives me bad dreams.
Your friends are safe for now, but that can change. As solutions go, violence is a temporary one.
The future isn't set.
Doesn't exactly fill me with confidence about defeating the Sith.
You protected people you cared about. That's a good thing.
[Flirt] Intentions matter.
Nice of you to say.
Some people in this galaxy just need to die. We shouldn't worry about reasoning with them.
No--appropriate.
Tell myself that every time we charge into a fight. It's them or us.
Still don't know if what I did on Nar Shaddaa was right or wrong. But it was... necessary.
Relief supplies ready for delivery. My friends are waiting--let's go.
Need a time-out. Got something on Nar Shaddaa that can't wait.
Some old friends are in a tight spot. Promised I'd help. Simple delivery, done in a jiff.
You've never mentioned having friends.
Sounds interesting.
I was popular before I joined the Jedi. Now I'm really popular.
Your old friends aren't my priority. There's a war on.
There isn't time for that.
Emperor's dead. We've got time for side projects.
Right, right--Emperor destroying the galaxy, gotta keep people alive. That's what I'm doing.
We're not just soldiers. We're allowed to help people. Look it up.
"Old friends"? "Delivery"? You need to do better than that.
Give me more information.
Gonna give me the third degree, huh? Shocking.
Nar Shaddaa has lots of refugees. The Hutts? Not known for their charity. People are starving.
My friends don't need anything fancy--just medpacs and nutrient paste. Stuff I can easily provide.
We'll set course for Nar Shaddaa as soon as possible.
It's a worthy cause.
Swell. They're already expecting us.
If we do this, I'll ask these friends for stories about your misspent youth.
[Flirt] I'll learn your past.
I'll have them make up good ones.
Get me to my friends, and I'll handle the rest.
Jedi leave families and friends when they join the order. Maintaining attachments draws you off balance.
You're attached to them.
Lecturing me about helping people. I've officially heard everything.
If we're still alive tomorrow and have some free time, I'll think about it.
No promises.
Your commitment is inspiring.
Nar Shaddaa. Refugee relief. Quick in-and-out. That's all I'm saying.
This is a nice ship. Shame we don't spend more time here.
Always up to our necks in bad guys... finding new ones to beat up. Fun--but not relaxing.
Until the Sith have been defeated, there isn't time for much else.
That's our mission.
Loosen up. You're already a shoo-in for "Jedi of the Year."
If you're feeling exhausted, Jedi mediation will clear your mind and replenish your energy.
You sound tired.
Sit around pretending not to think? Never worked for me.
Destroying Sith is my favorite way to unwind.
I live to fight.
It's restful for them, too--permanently.
You know what they say about all work and no play. We could use a hobby, or something.
I hear sabacc and pazaak are entertaining, although Jedi should never gamble.
We could play a game.
Cut the evasive maneuvers. You know what this is about.
I can't recommend any hobbies... but I could help you with an "or something."
[Flirt] Is that so?
About time. Starting to think that kiss was a fluke.
I didn't even have to draw you a picture. Nifty.
Don't go stir-crazy on me. I need you focused.
Pull yourself together.
I know you're not this dense. Do I have to draw a star chart?
We kissed. Got me thinking.
The Jedi Code only forbids attachments. Never says we can't enjoy ourselves. What do you say to that, tough guy?
I don't think I can enjoy myself with you and not form an attachment.
I care about you too much.
Wow. You mind-tricked me out of this conversation without even trying.
At least I have something new to think about--which is kind of like a hobby.
I think we've put this off long enough.
This. [Kiss Kira]
Glad we finally got that out of the way. Whoever said all the fun's in the anticipation was just lazy.
I don't know about you, but I feel a lot more relaxed.
I agree.
Told you we needed a hobby.
Speak for yourself. I'm already anticipating next time.
[Flirt] Not true.
Down, boy. Be mindful of attachments.
Now we have a reason to come back to the ship more often. Convenient.
This was wrong, Kira. We need to end things before they go any further.
Our romance is over.
Too much for you to handle? Your loss.
We're better off the way things are. My life's already too complicated.
No thanks. Not ever.
I could've made it simpler. Your loss.
Tell you what: I'll mind-trick myself into forgetting this conversation ever happened. You should, too.
Know what gets me? Wasting all our time blowing up bad guys.
Imagine how much better the galaxy would be if we focused on helping the needy. Not fighting Sith.
Until the Sith are defeated, there's only so much we can do.
We have no choice.
Not arguing that, just planning for the future.
I wouldn't mind a nice long vacation with someone special.
[Flirt] More time for us.
Noted. But after that?
The galaxy is what it is. We can't change that. We can only adapt.
Speculation is fruitless.
And adapting is exactly what I have in mind.
I'm a soldier, not an engineer. Without enemies, I don't have much to do.
I prefer fighting.
Not me. Already got big plans when the war's over.
It's time Jedi got political. Letting Senators run the Republic? Not working out.
We get the big picture, have the power to make things better. We should have control. Tell me I'm wrong.
The Force is for knowledge and defense, never to attack--or rule others.
You're wrong.
Not saying we'd be dictators. There'd be elections--which we'd win because we're better.
If Jedi controlled the Republic, we'd be like the Voss--or Sith.
This sounds familiar.
Voss and Sith aren't Jedi, they're creepy cults. People love Jedi--and they'd vote for us.
There's a good reason Jedi stay out of politics. We can't afford to compromise our ideals.
I don't know.
What if the Republic's how it is because the Jedi won't take charge? What if a little compromise is exactly what's needed?
The Senate's useless. If Jedi were in charge, there's nothing we couldn't do.
I agree with you.
Exactly. Tell you what--I'll be Supreme Chancellor. You run the military. Play to our strengths.
No point running for office until the war's over. Let's go win it already.
Ever since our dance with Darth Angral, I've felt different--"good" different. No more Emperor in my head.
Sick creep was dragging me down, holding me back. Being free from that? Nifty.
What the Emperor did to you was wrong--and he'll never do it again.
Yes, it is.
Mostly because he's dead--but the sentiment's nice.
Thought I was dead when we got captured--but he didn't even say hello. Kinda rude.
All that time he stole. Years I could've been... me.
You're positive the Emperor can't influence your mind?
Are you sure he's really gone?
All that's left are bad memories and an aversion to creepy old men--which is healthy.
You aren't free. The dark side will always be part of you.
Don't fool yourself.
You're the expert on dark things.
Never said I was pure as Alderaanian snow. Not my style.
You don't talk about what the Emperor did to you. Must've been bad.
I don't remember anything from that time. It's a blank.
There isn't much to tell.
Lucky you. Can't regret what you can't recall.
He took away my self-control. Forced me to do terrible things.
He made me his puppet.
Happens to the best of us. Wasn't your fault.
Mind your own business. I don't need a shoulder to cry on.
I don't want your sympathy.
At least he didn't hurt your cheerful attitude.
The Emperor's not our problem anymore--just his Empire. Don't know about you, but I'm looking forward to toppling it.
Best way to forget the past is to focus on the future. Let's make sure the Emperor gets what's coming.
Sad thing is, there's plenty more people out there still under the Emperor's thumb.
The Emperor won't be enslaving anyone for much longer. That's a promise.
We'll free everyone.
I'll give you this: You're consistently on-task.
Any estimate on the number of people the Emperor controls?
How many?
Could be thousands. To help them, we need to get rid of him.
I'll cut off that thumb--then his head.
He's a dead man.
I'd start the other way around. Sith get nasty when they lose a thumb.
We've still got a galaxy to save. Let's get back to it.
That whole "Jedi aren't allowed to feel emotions" rule? Don't get it. Sure, anger's bad. Why cross off everything else?
Anyone tell the troops they can't enjoy shore leave? Would we have a government if Senators couldn't throw wild parties?
Soldiers and Senators can't use the Force. Jedi who let their emotions lead them to the dark side can cause tremendous damage.
Jedi are different.
So? Bad soldiers can sabotage a whole army. Bad Senators could do even worse.
They almost treat us like children.
You have a point.
Pretty far past "almost," don't you think?
At least Sith are allowed to indulge themselves once in a while.
The Empire has it better.
In the Empire, "indulgence" means a license to ravage--but you get my point.
We're expected to throw ourselves into the fire? Fine. Let us off the leash.
No reason we can't live it up a little before we die.
There was a girl back on Tython. Not a Jedi, but... we had something. It didn't end well.
I tried, during my training.
News flash: Most relationships end badly. Half the fun. Don't let it stop you.
The Jedi Code exists for a reason, Kira. Indulging our passions is a risk.
That's dangerous.
Bottling up our feelings? Even riskier. What are you so afraid of?
You can start anytime--or do you like talking more than doing?
[Flirt] Ladies, first.
You asked for it....
Lot of buildup behind that. It was worth it.
See? I'm all about the doing.
So shut up and start living....
No reason at all. [Kiss Kira]
What do you know? The galaxy didn't end.
We'll try harder, next time.
To be continued, tough guy....
You're not like most Jedi. That's a compliment.
No offense to the Council, but if I stood around moralizing all day, I'd need a padded zero-G cell.
The Council is responsible not just for our order, but the entire Republic. They have to be careful.
Have some respect.
Know what I learned from my first Council meeting? I can sleep standing up.
That's why you and I get along. We're not afraid of diving into trouble.
[Flirt] We prefer action.
Trouble's only a problem if you can't handle it.
I'd rather be out in the galaxy, making a difference.
You and me both.
Let the Masters have their long, boring meetings. Keeps them from bothering us.
Who needs the Council anyway?
Master Satele would be crushed. You're her favorite.
Jedi need to get out more. Using the Force? It's fun. Mind and body supercharged. Everything's more intense.
The Force makes us strong, but it can also tear us apart if we don't use it wisely.
Be mindful of emotions.
We do what we must to protect others, Kira. Any personal benefits are incidental.
You enjoy moralizing as much as the Council. Too bad.
What about something that's already intense? A kiss, for instance.
[Flirt] Everything?
Some experiences are downright explosive--if you do them right.
I like intense experiences. How about a demonstration?
[Flirt] Show me.
Intense experiences... like what you did to me on Korriban? Still getting over that.
Whoa, tough guy. The Council would wag its finger at this conversation. Not that I care.
Should probably get moving. Galaxy in peril, and all that....
All I'm saying is, using the Force can be fun. The order needs to lighten up.
The fate of the galaxy depends on us, Kira. Never forget that.
We carry a heavy burden.
Already running for a seat on the Council, huh? Oh well.
Being a Jedi is more than just rules and responsibilities.
You're right.
Someday, I'll put a shock buzzer in Master Satele's chair, just to liven things up. You'd better have my back.
If you spent less time criticizing things you don't understand, you might learn something.
Nobody asked what you think.
Gee, you're right. I just learned about irony.
Ever wonder who you'd be, if the Jedi hadn't taken you in?
I was born to be a Jedi Knight. I could never be anything else.
This is what I've always been.
We both ran from the Sith. How much of us getting away was dumb luck?
I'm sure the Empire destroying your homeworld had nothing to do with it.
Life's a straight line, huh? That's very... you.
Imagining alternate paths only takes one out of the moment. Jedi should always remain grounded in the present.
A Jedi avoids speculation.
People say Jedi lack creativity. Can't imagine why.
Some days, I don't feel like a Jedi at all.
I'm not sure I am one.
Been there, still going. Every day.
I should be dead or worse a thousand times over. The first months after I escaped Korriban? Exciting.
Not easy staying alive when you're a ten-year-old Sith fugitive. No friends, no food, no home.
It never occurred to you to seek out the Jedi Order?
You could have come to Tython.
"Run to my mortal enemies" seemed like a bad plan. Stuck it out on Nar Shaddaa instead.
Leaving Korriban sounds hard enough. How'd you manage that?
How did you flee the Sith?
Helps if you're small. A head for Imperial transport schedules doesn't hurt.
One day, a big freighter dropped off slaves and left with a stowaway. Jumped ship on Nar Shaddaa.
Spent eight years sleeping in alleys. Good times. Finally got caught stealing a starship hyperdrive. Should've seen Master Kiwiiks's face.
I wondered how you two found each other. Stealing from a Jedi... that took some fortitude.
That's how you met her.
Didn't know she was a Jedi. Lots of people wear robes.
Hyperdrives aren't much good without a starship.
What a strange crime.
Flying's hard. Taking stuff apart and selling it? Easy.
Being trained as a Jedi was your punishment? How was that fair?
She didn't have you jailed?
Felt pretty harsh to me, too.
Still remember when Master Kiwiiks realized I was Force sensitive and asked me to be her Padawan. It was... weird.
Nobody ever gave me a choice before. Still getting used to that.
If the Empire conquers the galaxy, freedom will be the first casualty.
It's why we fight.
Along with phaseball, mom and sweet flatcakes. I get it.
You should be comfortable with it by now. When did Master Kiwiiks recruit you?
How long since you joined us?
Couple of years ago. What can I say? Old habits.
Point is, I know what I'd be if I weren't a Jedi--and I'm never going back.
Maybe it's better if I remove that distraction. I expect you to obey me without question.
Don't get too comfortable.
Of course you do. I breathlessly await your next command.
When you're done feeling sorry for yourself, let me know.
Skip the pity party.
Right. Keep forgetting everything's about you. Let's get back to your big important mission.
Starting to see why the Council disapproves of Jedi getting involved with each other.
It may be better to cool things off.
Whatever I've done, I apologize. Forgive me?
I'm sorry.
Huh. A straightforward apology. Didn't see that coming.
Not trying to start a fight. I... still like you. Just don't want things getting complicated.
At least give me a reason why you'd want that.
What's the problem?
Just a bad feeling. Maybe it'll pass, maybe it won't.
I don't have time for your temper tantrums.
Suit yourself, crybaby.
Next time you think about dropping by my quarters for a chat? Think again.
Spent enough time with Master Kiwiiks to know how Jedi should behave. You? Not doing it.
If the Council could see how you handle things, they'd yank you back to Tython in a heartbeat.
I'm trying my best, but there's room for improvement.
Maybe you're right.
Nice to see you admit it. Just don't stop there.
I do things this way for a reason. The Council understands.
No, they wouldn't.
Keep telling yourself that.
What would happen if they knew the truth about you? I could arrange that.
I'll tell them you're a Sith.
That right there? Not Jedi behavior. Point made.
Watch what you say, Kira. I'm your superior.
Don't threaten me.
No, you're my boss. Big difference.
Not a great time, all right? Don't we have a planet to save somewhere?
That doesn't mean we can't take time out for ourselves.
Always, but we can still talk.
It kinda does. When billions of innocent lives aren't on the line, we'll chat.
You seem upset. Talk to me about it.
I'm worried about you.
Used to think we had a lot in common, but lately... not so sure.
Kira, if I'm doing something that hurts you, tell me how to fix it.
Help me understand.
It's not gonna get fixed overnight. I need time alone, that's all.
Maybe we need to do something about the tension between us. Something... direct.
[Flirt] You're tense.
Wow. Where'd you get that line, a smuggler's holo collection? Bad play.
It's true. I used to think you were strong, smart and mature.
Me neither.
Not getting dragged into this with you. Save it, all right?
I knew you couldn't handle this. You pretend to be in control, but you're just a spoiled brat.
You're being childish.
That make it easier for you? Think whatever you want.
Don't know what Master Satele was thinking, sending you out to save the galaxy. The Jedi must be hard up.
You're either cracking under the pressure, or you're not the person the Council thinks. Either way, bad news for everybody.
There are people across this galaxy who owe their existence to me.
I've saved many lives.
They make up for all the people who don't exist, thanks to you? Don't bother answering. Rhetorical question.
If you know better, speak up. I'll listen.
Then help me change.
What do you want, a list? Won't help.
Can't believe I'm saying this... you need to meditate on the choices you've made.
Take a good long look at the person you're becoming, before it's too late.
It's only bad news for the people who cross me. I suggest you keep out of my way.
Especially you.
Planning to, trust me.
This thing we've got? Biggest mistake of our lives.
Good news is, fixing it's easy. We stop. Forever. Put the past in a box and focus on being better Jedi.
I'll respect your feelings. Our relationship is over.
If that's what you want.
Thanks for being a grown-up. Let's never have this talk again.
We always knew having a secret relationship wouldn't be easy. Let's not quit now.
Can't we try again?
Don't make this harder. It's over. Let it go.
You'll never be much of a Jedi, but watching you try could be amusing.
Good luck with that.
Thank you for the life lesson. You can go, now.
Been making an effort lately to increase my openness. I'm even extending the courtesy to people like you.
Requested a transfer back to Tython. Master Satele shot it down--for now. Sooner or later? I'm off this ship.
We don't make a good team. I look forward to your replacement.
That's for the best.
Good luck. Word's getting out what kind of Jedi you are. Not from me--but people still know.
I knew you were unhappy, but I thought it would work itself out. You'll be missed.
I'm sorry to hear that.
Pretending you care? Disturbing.
If you're unhappy, the air lock's right over there. You're welcome to get spaced anytime.
You can leave now.
By the way, I set up new security protocols in my quarters. Don't drop by unannounced. You need to reach me, leave a message.
When we're back at the ship, don't run off to practice your lightsaber forms. I'd like a chat--in private.
Next time we stop to catch our breath, let's talk.
Let's talk later. Feels like we ought to be saving the galaxy right now.
Never a dull moment. We should visit war zones more often.
Someday, let's retire from this Jedi business. Spend the rest of our lives having fun.
Let's go, partner. Still got plenty of work to do.
Always up to our necks in bad guys... finding new ones to beat up. Fun--but not relaxing.
You know what they say about all work and no play. We could use a hobby, or something.
We've still got a galaxy to save. Let's get back to it.
You're not like most Jedi. That's a compliment.
Know what I learned from my first Council meeting? I can sleep standing up.
Should probably get moving. Galaxy in peril, and all that....
Not a great time, all right? Don't we have a planet to save somewhere?
Have you seen what the Sith are wearing? It's like every fashion designer in the galaxy went over to the dark side.
We're outnumbered, underpowered and one step behind the enemy. Just once, I'd like to try it the other way.
You'll be glad to have me before this is done. I promise.
May the Force be with us.
I'm with you to the end, but I hope it's a long ways off.
Isn't teamwork grand?
If you mashed Hoth together with Tatooine, would it make a decent planet with nice weather?
